Problem: Class, take your seats! It's PRIME-time for a quiz... nc 2019shell1.picoctf.com 48028

Solution: 

```
Good morning class! It's me Ms. Adleman-Shamir-Rivest
Today we will be taking a pop quiz, so I hope you studied. Cramming just will not do!
You will need to tell me if each example is possible, given your extensive crypto knowledge.
Inputs and outputs are in decimal. No hex here!
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
q : 60413
p : 76753
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
n
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):^C
```

Answer: Y.

N = ```4636878989```

```
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
p : 54269
n : 5051846941
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
q
```

```p*q = n; where p and q are primes```

Thus ```5051846941/54269 = 	93089```

93089 is prime so its possible.

```
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
e : 3
n : 
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
q
p
```
No

```
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
q : 66347
p : 12611
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
totient(n)
```
(66347-1)(12611-1) = 836623060

```
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
plaintext : 6357294171489311547190987615544575133581967886499484091352661406414044440475205342882841236357665973431462491355089413710392273380203038793241564304774271529108729717
e : 3
n : 
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
ciphertext
```

Flag: ```picoCTF{UNSOLVED}```
